Correction: May 6, 2007, Sunday A statistical report on April 15 about the international book market misspelled the surname of the author of ''Measuring the World,'' a top international fiction best seller for 2006. He is Daniel Kehlmann, not Kellman.
The report also misstated the total number of copies of Paul Auster's ''Brooklyn Follies'' sold that year in the United States. It was 70,000 -- not 19,000, which was the paperback sales alone.
Correction: May 6, 2007, Sunday

A statistical report on April 15 about the international book market misspelled the surname of the author of ''Measuring the World,'' a top international fiction best seller for 2006. He is Daniel Kehlmann, not Kellman.
The report also misstated the total number of copies of Paul Auster's ''Brooklyn Follies'' sold that year in the United States. It was 70,000 -- not 19,000, which was the paperback sales alone.
